citation.article-title: Amycolatopsis eurytherma sp. nov., a thermophilic actinomycete isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Amycolatopsis eurytherma sp. nov.
Amycolatopsis eurytherma (eur.y.ther'ma. Gr. pref. eury many; Gr. n. therme heat; N.L. fem. adj. eurytherma grows over a wide temperature range)
The description is based on data taken from this and an earlier study (Sahin, 1995).

Aerobic, non-motile, Gram-positive, non-acid-alcohol-fast, catalase-positive actinomycetes that form extensively branched, substrate hyphae that fragment into squarish, rod-like elements (approx. 0.4-0.5x0.7-1.6 μm).
The substrate mycelium carries sparse, white, sterile aerial hyphae.

A yellow substrate mycelium is formed on modified Bennett's and glucose/yeast extract agars, but distinct substrate mycelial pigments are not evident on Czapek-Dox, glycerol/asparagine or oatmeal agars; diffusible pigments are not formed on any of these media.
Melanin pigments are not produced on peptone/ yeast extract/iron or tyrosine agars.
Growth occurs between 25 and 55 °C, but not at 10 or 60 °C, and at pH 6.0-9.0, but not at pH 5.0 or 10.0.
Elastin, L-tyrosine and xylan are degraded, but not adenine, aesculin, chitin or guanine.

Grows on adonitol, L-(­+)- arabinose, arabitol, D-(­+)-cellobiose, D-(­+)-fructose, D-(+­)-galactose, meso-inositol, D-(­+)-lactose, D-(-)-mannitol, D-(+­)-mannose, D-(­+)-melibiose, D-(­+)-melezitose, α-L-rhamnose, D-(-)-ribose, D-(-)-sorbitol, starch, D-(-)-sucrose, D-(­+)-trehalose, D-(-)-turanose, xylitol and D-(­+)-xylose (all at 1%, w/v) as sole sources of carbon and energy for growth, but not on D-(-)-raffinose (1%, w/v).

Sensitive to the following (concentrations given in μg ml-1 in parentheses): amikacin (4, 8 and 16), bacitracin (32), doxycyline (16, 32 and 64), fusidic acid (8), gentamicin sulfate (64), lividomycin A (16), neomycin sulfate (32), novobiocin (16 and 32), streptomycin sulfate (64), ticarcillin (16 and 32) and tyrothricin (16 and 32).

Resistant to the following (concentrations given in μg ml-1, except for penicillin G, in parentheses): ampicillin (8, 16 and 32), bacitracin (16), carbenicillin (12), cefoxitin (16 and 32), cephaloridine (32, 64 and 128), cephradine (8, 16 and 32), doxycyline hydrochloride (4), ethionamide (16), fusidic acid (4), gentamicin sulfate (32), gramicidin (8), lincomycin hydrochloride (32, 64 and 128), isoniazid (16), lividomycin A (4 and 8), nalidixic acid (32), neomycin sulfate (8), novobiocin (4), oleandomycin phosphate (16, 32, 64 and 128), penicillin G (5, 10 and 15 i.u.), polymyxin B sulfate (16 and 32), rifampicin (16, 32 and 64), spiramycin (10), streptomycin sulfate (4, 8, 16, 32 and 64), tetracycline hydrochloride (4, 8, 16 and 32), vancomycin (16, 32 and 64) and viomycin sulfate (20).
Additional phenotypic properties are shown in Table 2.
Isolated from arid and scrubland soil.
In addition to these properties, the type strain contains DNA with a G+C ratio of 73.1±0.9 mol%.
The type strain is strain NT202T (=DSM 44348T=NCIMB 13795T).
